title: (x) "Contemporary" straight sided sans - FF DIN (Mittelschrift) {Goran Soderstrom}
content:
Can anyone confirm this face... thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504031550im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_4756.jpg)

 [‹ Barney's of New York hand printed script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504031550/http:/typophile.com/node/19627 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Western style glyphic serif "El Tonal" - Brothers {Mike F} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504031550/http:/typophile.com/node/19619 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ryanharty

comments.content:
The name of the typeface is DIN, and I think this is the regular version of DIN.

Go to [www.fontfont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504031550/http:/www.fontfont.com/ "www.fontfont.com") - there you will find it.
Thanks very much... have a good weekend.

I recommend [FontShop.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504031550/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=FF%20DIN) over the antiquated FontFont.com. Both sites come from the same folks, FS.com is just newer and better.
